intro: Aronia × mitschurinii, commonly known as the black chokeberry, is a hybrid shrub native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its dark purple to black berries, which are rich in antioxidants and anthocyanins. The plant typically grows to a height of 1.5 to 3 meters and has alternate, simple, elliptical leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and edible fruits. Aronia × mitschurinii is also valued for its ability to tolerate poor soil conditions and its use in ornamental landscaping.
